timeline.bodyText: @ravisharda, is it possible to have only TLS enabled why AUTH is disabled? It looks a bit odd that both must be enabled or at least TLS cannot be enabled alone. I was told that there is something in the current design that forces so, could you please clarify a bit? Thanks
timeline.author: medvedevigorek

replies.bodyText:
@medvedevigorek technically both can be enabled/disabled independently of each other. So, you could have a config where TLS is enabled, but auth is disabled, just like you can have auth enabled with TLS disabled. However, in practical use, both shall be enabled in most cases.
The older flag in the system tests Jenkins job that represented "security enabled" only turned on auth, but not TLS, due to some of the inherent gaps that we had with the system tests configuration. With @ravibeta's changes, we can now have it enable both auth and tls.
With that background, as well as what the specific code in question does, it looks appropriate to call it TLS_AND_AUTH_ENABLED as opposed to just TLS_ENABLED.
Hope that clarifies.
replies.author: ravisharda

replies.bodyText:
okay, getting even more confused now.
I get the part that in most cases auth  and tls are enabled together as it doesn't really make sense to have auth without tls. However there could be valid cases where auth is not required by tls is required.
If in the current state we say that we always want to have both enabled then we have a bit confusing configuration:
securityEnabled - enables only auth part
tlsEnabled - enables tls and auth (this is what confuses me)
We need either
(a) securityEnabled - enables both auth and tls. And don't introduce tlsEnabled property at all
(b) Have both properties present and require both to be enabled or none. But tlsEnabled shouldn't change auth state.
What do you think?
replies.author: medvedevigorek

replies.bodyText: Yes Igor, it is too big a change for these system tests. May I please address it separately ? The issue is that pravega-operator deploys pravega cluster with the admin username and password and this can be fixed outside pravega repository first and accomodated in SDP. Thanks,
replies.author: ravibeta
